query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 «Ecco la fiera con la coda aguzza, 2 che passa i monti e rompe i muri e l’armi! 3 Ecco colei che tutto ’l mondo appuzza!».
query.error: **English:** 1 "Behold the beast with the sharp tail, 2 that crosses mountains and breaks through walls and weapons! 3 Behold her who stinks up the whole world!"
query.result: 1 "Efne ðæt deor ðæt ðone scearpan steort hæfð, 2 ðe ofer muntas gæð and ofer muras briceð and ofer wæpnu! 3 Efne ðæt ðe ealne ðone world bescyt!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Sì cominciò lo mio duca a parlarmi; 5 e accennolle che venisse a proda, 6 vicino al fin d’i passeggiati marmi.
query.error: **English:** 4 My guide began to speak to me; 5 and he beckoned me to come to the shore, 6 near the end of the marble pavement.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 E quella sozza imagine di froda 8 sen venne, e arrivò la testa e ’l busto, 9 ma ’n su la riva non trasse la coda.
query.error: **English:** 7 And that foul image of deceit 8 came forward, and arrived with head and trunk, 9 but did not drag its tail upon the shore.
query.result: 7 And ðæt laðe gesceaft ðæs facnes 8 com ðær to and ðæs heafdes and ðæs breostes, 9 ac ðone steort ne teah he on ðone strand.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 La faccia sua era faccia d’uom giusto, 11 tanto benigna avea di fuor la pelle, 12 e d’un serpente tutto l’altro fusto;
query.error: **English:** 10 His face was the face of a just man, 11 so benign was the skin that covered him, 12 and all the rest of his body was like a serpent’s;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 due branche avea pilose insin l’ascelle; 14 lo dosso e ’l petto e ambedue le coste 15 dipinti avea di nodi e di rotelle.
query.error: **English:** 13 he had two hairy arms, reaching to his armpits; 14 his back and chest and both his sides 15 were painted with knots and little wheels.
query.result: 13 twa wæron his earmas, swylce wulfes earmas, 14 and ða sidan and ða breost and ða bæc eall 15 gefrætewod mid næddran and mid snæddan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Con più color, sommesse e sovraposte 17 non fer mai drappi Tartari né Turchi, 18 né fuor tai tele per Aragne imposte.
query.error: **English:** 16 With more colors, subdued and superimposed, 17 never did Tartar or Turkish cloths make, 18 nor were such tapestries ever set up by Arachne.
query.result: 16 Mid maran litum, niðere of ufe, 17 næfre weoðode weder-tæppe 18 ne on telum geweorc ðurh ðone Tiwiscan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Come talvolta stanno a riva i burchi, 20 che parte sono in acqua e parte in terra, 21 e come là tra li Tedeschi lurchi
query.error: **English:** 19 As sometimes boats stand by the shore, 20 that are partly in the water and partly on land, 21 and as there among the greedy Germans
query.result: 19 Swa hwæðere stondað be sæcce sæcipu, 20 ðe beoð sumre on wætere and sumre on lande, 21 and swa þær betwux þam Teodiscan folce

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 lo bivero s’assetta a far sua guerra, 23 così la fiera pessima si stava 24 su l’orlo ch’è di pietra e ’l sabbion serra.
query.error: **English:** 22 the beaver settles down to wage its war, 23 so the evil beast was standing 24 on the edge that is of stone and encloses the sand.
query.result: 22 beofor sitteð his gewinn to fremmanne, 23 swa þæt feondlice deor þær fæste stod 24 ofer þam stanfate, and þone sand beheold.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Nel vano tutta sua coda guizzava, 26 torcendo in sù la venenosa forca 27 ch’a guisa di scorpion la punta armava.
query.error: **English:** 25 In the void, his tail thrashed about, 26 twisting upward the venomous fork 27 that armed its tip like a scorpion's sting.
query.result: 25 On ðæm wæne eall his steort wagode, 26 wyrmde up ða wyrmhóce attre, 27 ðe on ende wæs fæst swa scorpiones stinga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Lo duca disse: «Or convien che si torca 29 la nostra via un poco insino a quella 30 bestia malvagia che colà si corca».
query.error: **English:** 28 The leader said: "Now it is necessary that 29 our way turn a little towards that 30 evil beast that lies down over there".
query.result: 28 Þa cwæð se herewisa: "Nu is ðearf ðæt ure weg 29 lyt swigge on ða sidan to ðære 30 yflan tiligan ðe ðær licgeð".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Però scendemmo a la destra mammella, 32 e diece passi femmo in su lo stremo, 33 per ben cessar la rena e la fiammella.
query.error: **English:** 31 Therefore we descended to the right shoulder, 32 and we took ten steps along the edge, 33 in order to avoid both the sand and the flame.
query.result: 31 Þa stigon we niðer on ða swiðran eaxle, 32 and tyn fæðmum we eodon on ðam brince, 33 forðæm ðe we woldon forfleon ða sandas and ða lig.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 E quando noi a lei venuti semo, 35 poco più oltre veggio in su la rena 36 gente seder propinqua al loco scemo.
query.error: **English:** 34 And when we came to her, 35 a little farther on I see on the sand 36 people sitting near the empty place.
query.result: 34 And ða ða we to hyre comon, 35 lyt ðæs furðor ic geseah on ðæm sande 36 sittan folc gehende ðæm æmtigan stowe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.error: **English:** 37 Here the master said to me, "So that you may carry away a full 38 experience of this circle," 39 "go and see their punishment."
query.result: 37 Þær se lareow cwæð: "Þæt ðu fulle geondfaran 38 ðisses færelses, ðæt ðu mæge geferan," 39 he cwæð, "ga and geseoh heora yrmðu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Li tuoi ragionamenti sian là corti; 41 mentre che torni, parlerò con questa, 42 che ne conceda i suoi omeri forti».
query.error: **English:** 40 Let your words be brief; 41 while you return, I will speak with this one, 42 that she may grant us her strong shoulders.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Così ancor su per la strema testa 44 di quel settimo cerchio tutto solo 45 andai, dove sedea la gente mesta.
query.error: **English:** 43 Thus also up above the outermost head 44 of that seventh circle, all alone 45 I went, where the sorrowful people sat.
query.result: 43 Swa eac ofer ða ytemestan heafde 44 ðæs seofoðan hweorfes eal ana 45 ic eode, ðær ða murnende men sæton.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Per li occhi fora scoppiava lor duolo; 47 di qua, di là soccorrien con le mani 48 quando a’ vapori, e quando al caldo suolo:
query.error: **English:** 46 Through their eyes their grief burst forth; 47 here and there they helped themselves with their hands, 48 now against the fumes, now against the hot ground:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 non altrimenti fan di state i cani 50 or col ceffo or col piè, quando son morsi 51 o da pulci o da mosche o da tafani.
query.error: **English:** 49 in the same way dogs do in summer, 50 now with their snout, now with their paw, when they are bitten 51 either by fleas or by flies or by gadflies.
query.result: 49 na bet ne doð ða hundas on sumera 50 nu mid snute nu mid fote, ðonne ða flægan bítað 51 oððe ða flogan oððe ða myltestan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Poi che nel viso a certi li occhi porsi, 53 ne’ quali ’l doloroso foco casca, 54 non ne conobbi alcun; ma io m’accorsi
query.error: **English:** 52 Then, when I turned my eyes to certain ones, 53 in whose faces the sorrowful fire fell, 54 I recognized none of them; but I noticed
query.result: 52 Þa ic on ða ansyne sumra ðara manna geseah, 53 on ðam ðe ðæt sarige fyr feoll, 54 ne ic ðara nænigne ne oncneow; ac ic ongeat,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 che dal collo a ciascun pendea una tasca 56 ch’avea certo colore e certo segno, 57 e quindi par che ’l loro occhio si pasca.
query.error: **English:** 55 that from the neck of each one hung a pouch 56 that had a certain color and a certain design, 57 and it seemed that their eyes fed on this.
query.result: 55 ðæt æghwylc ðara hæfde on his swuran hangan 56 pone pung de hæfde sumne hiw and sumne tacn, 57 and ðanon me ðuhte ðæt heora eage wæron gefedde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 E com’ io riguardando tra lor vegno, 59 in una borsa gialla vidi azzurro 60 che d’un leone avea faccia e contegno.
query.error: **English:** 58 And as I come looking among them, 59 in a yellow purse I saw azure, 60 that had the face and bearing of a lion.
query.result: 58 And swa ic ðær smeagende ðurh ða menigu com, 59 on anum geolo sacce ic geseah heofones bleo, 60 ðe ðæs leones ansyn hæfde and ðæs wæpnedes hiw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Poi, procedendo di mio sguardo il curro, 62 vidine un’altra come sangue rossa, 63 mostrando un’oca bianca più che burro.
query.error: **English:** 61 Then, continuing my gaze forward, 62 I saw another one as red as blood, 63 showing a white goose, whiter than butter.
query.result: 61 Þa ic forð gewat ðurh ðone wudu dimme, 62 ða geseah ic ðær oðre fugelas fleogan, 63 ða wæron hwitte swa snaw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 E un che d’una scrofa azzurra e grossa 65 segnato avea lo suo sacchetto bianco, 66 mi disse: «Che fai tu in questa fossa?
query.error: **English:** 64 And one who had marked his white pouch 65 with a big blue sow, 66 said to me: "What are you doing in this ditch?
query.result: 64 And an ðe of anum swinan blawan and miclan 65 getacnod hæfde his hwite põsan, 66 cwæð to mē: "Hwæt dest ðu on ðissum dic?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Or te ne va; e perché se’ vivo anco, 68 sappi che ’l mio vicin Vitalïano 69 sederà qui dal mio sinistro fianco.
query.error: **English:** 67 Now go away; and since you are still alive, 68 know that my neighbor Vitaliano 69 will sit here on my left side.
query.result: 67 Nu ðe gang; and forðæm ðe ðu eart gyt lybbende, 68 wite ðæt min neahgebur Witalianus 69 sitteð her on minre wynstran handa.

73 che recherà la tasca con tre becchi!”». 74 Qui distorse la bocca e di fuor trasse 75 la lingua, come bue che ’l naso lecchi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 E io, temendo no ’l più star crucciasse 77 lui che di poco star m’avea ’mmonito, 78 torna’mi in dietro da l’anime lasse.
query.error: **English:** 76 And I, fearing that he might torment further 77 him who had just warned me to stay a short while, 78 turned back from the weary souls.
query.result: 76 And ic ðæs ondrædende ðe he leng ne geswencte 77 ðone ðe me ær lytle fyrst gemælde, 78 gewende me eft fram ðam werigum sawlum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Trova’ il duca mio ch’era salito 80 già su la groppa del fiero animale, 81 e disse a me: «Or sie forte e ardito.
query.error: **English:** 79 My guide, who had already mounted 80 the back of the fierce beast, found me, 81 and said to me: "Now be strong and bold.
query.result: 79 Min latteow fand ðe ðær wæs astigende 80 ofer ðæs wildan deores hrycg, 81 and cwæð to me: "Nu ðu scealt beon strang and gearo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Omai si scende per sì fatte scale; 83 monta dinanzi, ch’i’ voglio esser mezzo, 84 sì che la coda non possa far male».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 tal divenn’ io a le parole porte; 89 ma vergogna mi fé le sue minacce, 90 che innanzi a buon segnor fa servo forte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

97 e disse: «Gerïon, moviti omai: 98 le rote larghe, e lo scender sia poco; 99 pensa la nova soma che tu hai».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Maggior paura non credo che fosse 107 quando Fetonte abbandonò li freni, 108 per che ’l ciel, come pare ancor, si cosse;

109 né quando Icaro misero le reni 110 sentì spennar per la scaldata cera, 111 gridando il padre a lui «Mala via tieni!»,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 che fu la mia, quando vidi ch’i’ era 113 ne l’aere d’ogne parte, e vidi spenta 114 ogne veduta fuor che de la fera.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Ella sen va notando lenta lenta; 116 rota e discende, ma non me n’accorgo 117 se non che al viso e di sotto mi venta.
query.error: **English:** 115 She goes swimming slowly, slowly; 116 she turns and descends, but I do not notice 117 except that the wind blows on my face and from below.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Io sentia già da la man destra il gorgo 119 far sotto noi un orribile scroscio, 120 per che con li occhi ’n giù la testa sporgo.
query.error: **English:** 118 Already from the right hand I heard the whirlpool 119 making a horrible crashing sound beneath us, 120 so that I thrust my head down with my eyes.
query.result: 118 Ic ða gehyrde ða on ðære swiðran hand 119 ðone wælm nyðan me orudlice scriðan, 120 ðurh ðæt ic ða mid ðam heafde hwearf nið.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Allor fu’ io più timido a lo stoscio, 122 però ch’i’ vidi fuochi e senti’ pianti; 123 ond’ io tremando tutto mi raccoscio.
query.error: **English:** 121 Then I was more fearful at the rustling, 122 because I saw fires and heard lamentations; 123 whereat, trembling, I huddled all together.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 124 And ða ic geseah, ðeah ic hit ær ne geseah, 125 ðone stigendan and ðone ymbhoga ðara miclena yfela 126 ðe ða genealæhton of missenlicum stede.
